comments.body: Piglin bartering already provides renewable nether quartz.
I think it would be better if smelting Nether Quartz results in a Ghast Tear.

This might be more of a negative for those of us that like skipping to the excitement, in this case, the ore. If the ore gave some sort of bonus against the wither, being rare already, and led to increased speed for fighting the wither, with some sort of more exciting loot from said wither, I would be 100%. I 70% disagree with this suggestion, as I believe minecraft should be more of a sandbox than a 100% forced progression type of game, (though I still like the idea of progression). However, if the wither had more of a purpose for us to fight it, A.K.A. more and better loot, and was changed a bit, I would have no problem with the progression from this kind of boss fight. An example of loot would be some sort of key, for a new boss/for opening a door, or a new material of sorts. A unique idea would be something allowing zombification/zombie cures for mobs, and strange science experiments you could do from this new loot. Something interactive, and interesting, without extended requirements. To build/implement.

I like where your idea is going.
Please don't. This isn't Terraria. It would also (presumably) require netherite to only spawn in chunks newly generated after killing the wither which would make netherite even MORE painful to get.
I agree, when the new update comes out, most people will just jump from iron to Netherite.
I love the idea. We should have multiple alloys that can serve as upgrades to weapons/armor. Can they stack? I would like to be able to upgrade, with some materials, on more than just diamond.

I like the idea but i think that could be done in that each armor has 3 variants:

Vanilla variant, the original gives armor and the capability of using enchantment.

Heavy Variant, a variant which reduces you movement speed, jump but it reduces the knockback and the arrow damage it also greatly increases armor.

Light Variant, a variant which reduces your movement speed(small), increases you defence (small) lets you jump, run and walk normally.

Now the elytra (if backpack slot is added) if you have any item of this type it will reduce the flying height of each burst.

Vanilla: Helmet and boots (-1 block), legs (-2 blocks) and (-3 block)

Light: Helmet and boots (-1 block), legs (-1 block) and (-1 block)

Heavy: Helmet and boots (-2 blocks), legs (-3 blocks) and (-4 block)

This could make more interesting to play with these variant also if you dont want to use them stick to the vanilla one and the falling speed will increase if  the armor is heavier.

You can make also each material be heavier or lighter which could be good but id better to adding variants wich can be used to the original resources.

Flimsy is the right word for leather (which is useless in real life and too hard to get to be convenient in-game) and I think this would give some neat ways to make something that is underused better. and by that, I mean it would make chainmail better, leather's only use is being dyed.

I made a suggestion like this on the subreddit a while back.  I think I called it something like nature vs. nurture.  It would let you breed a healthier horse with better stats but the raised abilities wouldn't be heritable.

Other than that though, I love the idea.

dang i was going to make a post about this, and the piglin shaman which i made a post about that is still pending approval would be a semi-boss that would also be a very important part of the raid.

to start the raid the player must either kill a piglin shaman or a piglin brute with a piglin banner in a bastion to get an effect similar to the bad omen, once reaching a village the raid will start, nether portals different from the regular portal starts being generated all around the village, those portals don't have any block around them and entities can't enter in it, only leave, and obviously the ones that makes part of the raid are piglins, hoglins, brute piglins, magma cubes, piglin shamans and a new mob: skeleton chicken that is much bigger than a chicken, it spawn in raids being riden by a piglin, piglins can also be riding hoglings, besides those the raids behave similar to the illager raid, but piglins burn houses instead of using some magic on them, while the raid is actived piglins and hoglins will have an effect that prevents them from turning into their zombified versions outside the nether which i also mentioned in the piglin shaman post.

beating the raid gives many benefits to the player, like a large amount of drops from these mobs, gold and also gives an effect to the player that causes all piglins to be neutral to the player even whitout wearing gold armor, make they constantly give items to the player and recruit them as bodyguards for gold

While it is true that a locked map cannot be unlocked, that does not mean that an unlocked copy cannot be retrieved. I had a bit of trouble working out the syntax to use the give command for this but you can put the map in a chest by using this command   

data merge block x y z {Items:[{Slot: 0b, id:"minecraft:filled_map", Count:1b, tag: {map:###}}]}

where x y z are the coordinates of a (preferably empty) chest and ### is the number of the original map before locking. The map will be in the top left slot of the chest.

If this was to be added into the game, it must have the rules of the Protection law: You can't have different kinds of Protection enchants on the same item.

The EPF (Enchantment protection factor holds up to 20 max)

Protection 4 set is in total of 16 EPF, which 16 times by 4 is 48% damage reduction from the 20% of the damage you receive from regular diamond armor which protects at 80%.

Creeper explosions are most critical to damage even if you are with max out protection 4 diamond armor they can still blow you up on hard mode, so adding hulk II enchantment would still be worth it as it's more of an late game grind.

Hulk II is not going to be a part of protection or EPF enchantments, it's an enchantment that will give you effect boosts only.

I understand what you mean but it's only giving you out the effects.

See the issue here isn't that the game doesn't have a flashlight in the game (Torches, Lanterns, light source blocks in general), it's that the lighting engine has a difficult time supporting dynamic lighting, which your suggestion is surrounded around.

So, optimization of the lighting engine would be the first step to getting this feature.

Itis not mean to replace torches (because it consumes redstone veru fast), but to act as portable source of light in tought situations (like escaping from Warden).

Aiming for different vague areas for different advantages sounds good (For example, "Upper body" or "Lower body"), but the last paragraph, especially biting and aiming for testicles, wouldn't really fit into Minecraft. It's ESRB rating is E10+, for "Fantasy Violence": The violence in Minecraft is technically there, but it's indiscreet and not in great detail. When you punch something, your player model has a vague animation of your arm swinging (The same one used for destroying, placing, and using objects of just about any kind), then the receiver of the punch gets knocked back a bit, has a red tint as a simple indicator of taking damage, and loses however much health. It's not supposed to be visually in detail, it's supposed to be a less gruesome take on something that would otherwise have a much higher ESRB rating, and if a player wants it to be more gruesome / detailed, they can let their imagination fill in the holes.

 

A "Pulling" move that drags an opponent towards you at close range could be a good addition if done right, even if fishing rods sort of do that job already. It barley even requires an animation, and could possibly change combat in a functional way. It could also possibly be used outside of combat, maybe as a way to guide players / mobs you don't want to hit, or as a utility in Creative mode.
Sounds like something to put on marketplace.

maybe when you go back in time a village would not be there yet but you could see ancient villagers building sand and jungle temples and mineshaft would have miners in them. voted

A time mechanic, and the ability to traverse it! The game memorizing states and constantly tracking things such as number and state of all blocks/objects in a world, block placement, world states, seasons, death time and location, and player/other inventories over the course of in game time. Exact date could be represented as a coordinate.

I wouldn't expect much, especially at first because of system requirements. I imagine it would be impossible to memorize exact player or mob movements, for example. Maybe it could be done to an extent though.

I see this as an opportunity to have the game automatically save more/introduce the ability to travel further forwards or backwards in time. You can already skip (aka time travel) to the next morning by sleeping in a bed at the beginning of night, so if commands were input via creative menus, or an exact date input into a time machine* (see time machine item post) the player(s) would get a chance to go to a previous, current, or future time and date, but at current coordinates. Since you can't turn off the autosave feature anymore, if you die and lose an item, it's gone. A good way to think about this is like a new coordinate; a new category of location. It'd enable one to farm crops/resources that aren't currently ready for harvest, revisit past destroyed structures, bring back deceased companions as long as they were named with a nametag, and undo undesired actions (going afk to have your house be blown up by a creeper.)
They would have to add self-learning ai in Minecraft in order to add this.
